primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a new reality of cosmic generosity through the Easter event, shattering exclusionary categories and inviting humanity into a 'new inclusiveness'.

tekstueel_bewijs: God, that deep power for life, has shattered the system of death
God is bringing the world to a new inclusiveness
God... has made all things new
a new reality in the world that is unrestrained by the force of fear

zender.identificatie: The Easter Event / The Living Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: Easter is the summit of cosmic generosity
generous to all who call upon him
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify as a Receiver of generosity who must then become a Subject of imitation.

tekstueel_bewijs: Paul exclaims: There is no distinction!
this evangelical logic of the Gospel
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject, but Jesus is also presented as a model who 'had to learn'.
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent; replaced by 'the deep power for life' or 'logic'.

tegenstander.identificatie: The System of Death / Tribalism / Categories of Control
tekstueel_bewijs: our categories of control and resistance
the tempter... trying to talk the church out of its identity
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a 'system of death' and 'force of fear', suggesting an ontological/cosmic struggle rather than mere bad habits.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church imitates God's generosity through social action and inclusion.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon argues that because God is generous (Program 1), the church must now engage that inclusiveness (Program 2).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Easter Event → Cosmic Generosity → All Humanity

God is bringing the world to a new inclusiveness

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We are invited... to watch Paul
We want some of the ancient protections
Imagine a church so rich in gifts

voorbeelden: God is now calling the church to engage that inclusiveness
what Paul expects from his churches... is a generosity that imitates
We want the world on our own terms
identify the others who are toughest for us

he will command his angels concerning you

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the 'Willing' (Vouloir) — shifting the hearer's desires from tribalism to generosity. It assumes that once the 'logic' is understood, the church 'must' (Devoir) act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Exclusion) to ~S2 (Boundary-crossing) via the intervention of S1 (God's Generosity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'Easter claim' which vetoes the categories of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Tribalism is treated as a deep-seated human resistance to God.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon begins with strong theocentric language (God shattering death), it pivots into a heavy 'Imitatio Dei' model where the church becomes the primary Subject of the second half. It flirts with exemplarism by suggesting Jesus 'had to learn' generosity.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus himself had to learn that reach beyond the familiar
God is now calling the church to engage that inclusiveness

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God, that deep power for life, has shattered the system of death
To the deserving, the undeserving, only one requirement: call upon him.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is used as a model of someone who resisted temptation and learned to be inclusive, rather than the one who empowers the church to do so.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of Jesus 'learning' to reach out, a theocentric reading would see Jesus as the 'Generosity of God' incarnate, who sovereignly breaks the boundaries the church cannot.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform 'generosity' through the private sector and legislation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as an imitation of a divine logic rather than a participation in Christ's life.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's act to the church's duty is logically tight but theologically shifts the burden of 'making the new reality' onto the church's imagination.
spanning_punten: The shift from 'God shattered the system' to 'the church must engage inclusiveness' risks making God's victory dependent on church implementation.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: shattered the system of death and made all things new

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on 'Logic' and 'Imagination' rather than the Spirit to provide the 'Pouvoir-faire'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is 'tribalism' and 'categories of control' that require a cosmic shattering.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon has a strong theocentric start but moves toward an anthropocentric 'vocation of generosity' that lacks a clear Helper (Holy Spirit).

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The church becomes the subject of 'bringing inclusiveness'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Maintain God as the subject who continues to include the 'others' through the church.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'God is calling the church to engage,' use 'The Spirit of the Risen Lord is sweeping the church into His own work of inclusion.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must 'imagine' and 'set down' others in God's generosity.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the one who is *also* the 'other' being brought in by God.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Remind the hearer that they are not just the dispensers of generosity, but the 'undeserving' recipients of it.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Resurrection provides the actual power to love the enemy, not just the 'logic' to do so.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as 'The System of Death'.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats the opponent with appropriate cosmic weight.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) begins to overshadow the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology) in the final third.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ensure the 'Angels bearing you up' (Ps 91) is the ground of the journey, not just a safety net for the church's effort.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful, rhetorically gifted sermon that successfully grounds social ethics in the Resurrection, though it occasionally slips into moral exemplarism regarding Jesus' own ministry.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'logic' and 'lyricism'; semiotics reveals that the 'logic' actually replaces the Holy Spirit as the Helper.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of 'Lord' in Romans 10; semiotics focuses on who is doing the 'shattering' and 'including'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that while the sermon uses 'Grace' language, the actantial Subject shifts to the Church in the application, creating a 'Mixed' structure.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly effective at deconstructing tribalism but relies on the hearer's 'imagination' as the primary engine for the secondary narrative program.
